content:
I think your revised message is even stronger! You've successfully distilled the essence of your initial message into a concise and clear inquiry. Here's why I think it works well:

1. **Direct and to the point**: You clearly state your interest in a novel-writing group and your expectations.
2. **Relevant context**: You mention your previous experience with a writing group, which adds context to your search and shows you're not new to the concept.
3. **Specific questions**: You ask targeted questions about the group's format, experience, and expectations, which will help you gauge whether the group is a good fit.
4. **Brevity**: Your message is short and easy to read, making it more likely to be well-received by the group leaders or members.

The only minor suggestion I have is to consider adding a brief mention of your writing goals or what you're working on. This can help the group leaders or members understand your writing context and provide more tailored information about their group. However, if you're concerned about keeping the message concise, you can always omit this detail and focus on the essential questions.

Overall, your revised message is clear, concise, and effective. I think it's ready to go!
